meanings.definition: False or exaggerated statements or claims
meanings.sent1: She knew his story was full of bullshots.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was filled with bullshots.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled at the bullshots their friend made up.
meanings.sent4: His excuse was just a bunch of bullshots to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent5: The teacher could easily spot the bullshots in the student's report.

meanings.sent1: Stop talking that bullshots, it makes no sense.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes were just silly bullshots.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa always tells us stories full of bullshots to make us laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation sounded like a stream of bullshots flowing out.
meanings.sent5: The movie was so bad, it felt like two hours of pure bullshots.

meanings.definition: Deceptive or misleading photographs or images
meanings.sent1: The magazine cover had obvious bullshots of the celebrity.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement used bullshots to make the product look better.
meanings.sent3: The artist created a painting full of bullshots to confuse viewers.
meanings.sent4: The website's homepage was full of bullshots to attract visitors.
meanings.sent5: The documentary exposed the bullshots used in the news industry.
